Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mj-AMP1 (MjAMP1, natural AMPs; knottin-type peptide; Jalapa defensin; UCSS1a;3S=S; flowering seed plants)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: without disulfide bonds, it lost antifungal activity against F. culmorum.

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active against fungi A. brassicola (IC50 20 ug/ml), A.pisi (IC50 200 ug/ml), B. cinerea (IC50 60 ug/ml), C. beticola (IC50 10 ug/ml), C. lindemuthianum (IC50 6 ug/ml), F. culmorum (IC50 30 ug/ml), F. oxysporum (IC50 15 ug/ml or >200 ug/ml), N. haematococca (IC50 15 ug/ml), P. betae (IC50 25 ug/ml), P.tritici-repentis (IC50 300 ug/ml), P. oryzae (IC50 6 ug/ml), R. solani (IC50 60 ug/ml), V. dahliae (IC5012 ug/ml), V. inaequalis (IC50 12 ug/ml), bacteria B. megaterium (IC50 6 ug/ml), E.carotovora (IC50 >500 ug/ml), E.coli (IC50 >500 ug/ml), and S. lutea (IC50 100 ug/ml).Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bonds.Antimicrobial robustness: activity was not influenced by heat treatment at 100oC for 10 min.Transgenic plants: expression of this peptide in tomato enhances resistance to early blight disease (Planta. 2005 Nov;222(5):858-66). Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Cammue BPA, de Bolle MFC, Terras FRG, Proost P, van Damme J, Rees SB, Vanderleyden J, Broekaert WF.1992
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterization of a novel class of plant antimicrobial peptides from Mirabilis jalapa L. seeds.
